page.title: 13SOUTH SITCH
page.content: The most attractive house in Idridgehay is an old timber-framed house called South Sitch. It is Elizabethan in age it has beautiful surroundings. It is a timber-framed thatched roof building with plaster filling in the spaces that are between the timber-frames. Inside South Sitch it is very grand and complicated but in all it is a very homely place. The Mellor family built South Sitch in the sixteen hundreds.The Mellor family added a brick addition in eighteen forty. Some Cromwell weapons have been found in the thatch of South Sitch and they are very valuable.In the grounds there are a few pools that were used to keep fish in, and also there is an ice house that was used to keep meat.
